intro: Peucedanum ferulaceum, commonly known as wild carrot or bishop's weed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its seeds are small, dry, and often used in culinary and traditional medicine. The entire plant has a distinctive, spicy aroma due to the presence of volatile oils.
